## ResourceManager.serializeObject() method

Serialize an object to a JSON structure using registered class metadata.

**Signature:**

```typescript
serializeObject(obj: any, json?: any, asyncTasks?: Promise<unknown>[]): Promise<any>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

obj


</td><td>

any


</td><td>

The object to serialize.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

json


</td><td>

any


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Optional existing JSON object to fill.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

asyncTasks


</td><td>

Promise&lt;unknown&gt;\[\]


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Optional list to collect async tasks for embedded asset export.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

Promise&lt;any&gt;

The serialized JSON structure.

## Remarks

- Throws if the object's class is not registered. - Populates `asyncTasks` with pending I/O tasks for embedded resources.
